cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW then NW into the southeast Gulf of Mexico, curve northeast across Florida’s Big Bend, and move offshore of the GA/SC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend region of north-central Florida near Cedar Key

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend and northeast Gulf Coast, then Georgia–South Carolina Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late Thu–Fri; breezy squalls possible earlier
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches with locally higher amounts; risk of brief flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Thunderstorms and lightning within rain bands could briefly halt cargo handling operations
